action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller of West Virginia (for herself and Ms. Sewell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend Medicare-dependent hospital and Medicare low-volume hospital payments, and to direct the Comptroller General of the United States to carry out a report on Medicare rural hospital classifications.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Assistance for Rural Community Hospitals Act or the ARCH Act.

section.header: Extending Medicare-dependent hospital and Medicare low-volume hospital payments

paragraph.text: Section 1886(d)(5)(G) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(G)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (i), by striking October 1, 2024 and inserting October 1, 2029; and
in clause (ii)(II), by striking October 1, 2024 and inserting October 1, 2029.
Section 1886(b)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(b)(3)(D)) is amended—

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking October 1, 2024 and inserting October 1, 2029 ; and
in clause (iv), by striking fiscal year 2024 and inserting fiscal year 2029,.

subparagraph.text: Section 13501(e)(2) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 (42 U.S.C. 1395ww note) is amended by striking fiscal year 2024 and inserting fiscal year 2029,.

subsection.text: Section 1886(d)(12) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(12)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subclause (I), by striking through 2024 and inserting through 2029;
in subclause (III), by striking through 2024 and inserting through 2029; and
in subclause (IV), by striking 2025 and inserting 2030; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking through 2024 and inserting through 2029; and
in clause (ii), by striking through 2024 and inserting through 2029.

section.header: GAO report on Medicare rural hospital classifications
section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to Congress a report on Medicare rural hospital classifications that includes the following information:

paragraph.text: The total number of hospitals that, with respect to any of the 5 fiscal years preceding such date of enactment, had any of the following classifications:

subparagraph.text: Classification as a critical access hospital (as defined in section 1861(mm)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(mm)(1))).
Classification as a rural emergency hospital (as defined in section 1861(kkk)(2) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(kkk)(2))).
Classification as a rural referral center (as described in section 1886(d)(5)(C) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(C)).
Classification as a sole community hospital (as defined in section 1886(d)(5)(D)(iii) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(D)(iii))).
Classification as a medicare-dependent, small rural hospital (as defined in section 1886(d)(5)(G)(iv) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(G)(iv))).
Classification as a low-volume hospital (as defined in section 1886(d)(12)(C)(i) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(12)(C)(i))).

paragraph.text: An analysis of the extent to which there is overlap between the criteria for any two or more of the classifications described in paragraph (1).

subparagraph.text: simplification with respect to such classifications and any such overlap; and
changes with respect to the criteria for such classifications that would promote financial sustainability for rural hospitals and improve access to health care for individuals in rural areas.

paragraph.text: The projected effects of allowing sole community hospitals (as described in paragraph (1)(D)) and medicare-dependent, small rural hospitals (as described in paragraph (1)(E)) to use a cost reporting period beginning during fiscal year 2019 for the purpose of calculating adjusted payments under section 1886(d)(5) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)).
